Reviews.Title: “Such a lovely, beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kaikai1
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Paris for my birthday and we stayed for 5 nights. The staff are so kind and helpful, they were there at our beck and call. The rooms were good size (a pet peeve of my husband) and they close the shutters during turn down service....slept like a rock!! Great beds as well. The gym, spa and pool are beautiful. I enjoyed swimming laps in the evening. The neighborhood is quiet, convenient to the Arc and Eiffel Tower. The concierge suggest two excellent restaurants as well. This is such a beautiful little gem, I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: AriMP
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with our two children age 4 and 8. We stayed in a Junior Suite which was quite large, especially by European standards. This is a beautiful hotel that is clean and quiet. Most impressive was the service which was on par, if not better, than any Four Seasons Hotel I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and Everything You Need”
Reviews.Author: ericsvision
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for a little business but mostly pleasure. We had a great room just a few blocks from the Champ-Elyses. Staff was excellent and lots of great Biatros within walking distance. If you are looking for a massive 5 star this isn't it, but if you want a very nice hotel for value with good sized rooms ( and a pretty good gym ) this is a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: mr610
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 4 nights in a suite at the Majestic. Beautiful hotel with modern design. The staff is very friendly and helpful, rooms are clean and refreshed through the day/night. Nice breakfast offered in the morning. Great location off the Arc de Triomphe with easy access to three metro lines. The only issue is that there is construction right outside the hotel as the Peninsula hotel is being built causing noise issues even on the weekend. It looks like the construction will continue for quite a while.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in a proper 5* Hotel”
Reviews.Author: real04jeff
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Villa & Hotel Majestic with 2 children. After a mistake on our side with the booking, we were upgraded to a suit (paying the difference), which was very spacious and comfortable. We dined at the restaurant a couple of nights and though the table set-up is not very children-friendly (low chairs...), high chaires for babies are available and the staff was charming with the kids. Simple menu, good food. Breakfast is overpriced for what it offers (simple buffet for both continental and hot food section), so you are better off with nearby boulangeries. The hotel is clean, welcoming, quiet, with touch of luxury and design here and there. Well positioned for Champs-Élysées, Arc the Triomphe and other touristic hotspots surrounding this area. One thing that really made our stay special at the hotel was the friendliness and helpfulness of staff. We used concierge for a few recommendations and bookings and the service was quick and spotless. There is also a small play room for and scooters for children are available. The pool in the Spa is big enough for a swim, very clean, well equipped for children as well (though 1.5 meters min depth). Very goood stay, this hotel made our visit to Paris very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge was the best”
Reviews.Author: SeaFoodTokyo
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in this hotel. I got sugesstion about some restaurants form concierge of this hotel. He recomended the best restaurant in Paris for 2 days. It was fantastic! I really appreciate for MR.CONCIERGE of the Mejesty. He is the best concierge in my life. But, not only the conceirge of this hotel but also room is clean, fine bath room and toiretswhich ar much more than the cost I paid. I would like to visit this hotel again with my bathing suits and sneaker for their fine gym. But, think about Esthetique. It was so soft for me.

Reviews.Title: “You will find a well speaker of every language!”
Reviews.Author: Horia C
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet room, with a very nice bath room. The staff are very good. We find here a romanian girl at the reception...nice surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkers12
Reviews.Content: Spent a very pleasant two nights here after the New Year. Two very nice grand deluxe rooms - comfortable, attractively designed and fitted. Excellent modern attractive bathroom with bath and shower. Great spa with lovely pool. The bar area is small but comfortable and a pleasant place for a drink. Friendly and reliable staff. We did not eat at the hotel, but the prices for dinner seemed ok - the price of breakfast is silly at euro 27.

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough for what it costs”
Reviews.Author: geosam80
Reviews.Content: Coming from Budapest and having just stayed at the "Sofitel Chain Bridge Hotel" in a better room, with an astonishing view, paying only 1/3 of the money that Majestic costed, there was no way we could be impressed by this hotel, even if you consider that "this is Paris", not Budapest. Also, the rose petals that the hotel offered in it's "romantic package" (which costed an extra 100 euros, among with a -quite good- champagne and a couple of macarons), as we were honeymooners, were fake (by fabric). And furthermore, they even charged extra for wifi internet! In terms of location, next time we go to Paris, we would prefer a hotel either nearer to the shopping areas (e.g. near Opera) or a little further out of centre for a better value for money, since being close to the Arch you still need the Metro to go near the river banks, to the Tower or to go shopping. Other than that, of course, no one can say that this is a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, room, and most of all...gym and pool!”
Reviews.Author: winewitheverything
Reviews.Content: The hotel is spotless and the staff are extremely polite, professional and friendly. Rooms are spacious -- for example, they separated the king bed into two twins with a bedside table in between and there was STILL enough space in the room. We were so busy doing the touristy stuff that we had only 1 opportunity to use the gym and pool - but what a gym and pool - elegant, clean and one of the best gyms/pools I've seen. The only suggestion I'd make is to provide complimentary wifi in the room and bottled water. Other than that, great hotel, close to Champs Elysees, Arc de Triomphe, yet far enough from the crowds so we had peace and quiet. Clean neighbourhood..

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!!”
Reviews.Author: bonitabeachbabe
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 weeks and was still sad to leave. The hotel staff was truly the best of any hotel at which I have ever stayed which I don't say lightly. I lost an earring on the way back from work and one of the guys there searched the streets with me for 30 minutes. And this was a their standard level of service. I loved the kitchenette especially for the espresso machine and kettle. There was even a small dishwasher but the cleaning staff did the dishes anyway. And the gym/pool was icing on the cake. Only small glitch was sauna and steam seemed never to be turned on (Really if this is the worst thing) Roof terraces weren't open (not sure why) but (again) , the staff offered to open them for me. Stay here and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “If the location doesn't blow you away, the service definitely will!!”
Reviews.Author: donmoraes
Reviews.Content: I am not really one to write reviews about hotels but after having had a wonderful experience at the Villa and Hotel Majestic, I decided to make an exception. Deciding on a hotel to stay at while visiting Paris for 2 nights was pretty traumatic. This was largely due to the fact that most of my friends that had been to Paris before told me to expect small rooms and horrible service from even the best 5 star hotels there. In the end I decided to book a room at the Villa & Hotel Majestic based entirely on online user reviews and it turned out to be a fabulous choice. Sure the hotel might be slightly pricey compared to other boutique hotels...but the experience was completely worth it. The location would have to be one of the hotel's main plus points since it is less than a 5 minute walk from the Arc de Triumph and the Champs Elysees. It is also less than a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower not to mention the close proximity to metro stations. I doubt you will find a hotel which is placed more conveniently for a tourist. The room was extremely spacious for 2 people and the decor was perfect. The large windows allow the room to be flooded with light so you will always step into a bright room which is personally very important to me. The room was equipped with all your normal modern amenities and had ample closet space as well. The beds were extremely comfortable and the bathrooms were neat and clean. But I think the service is what truly blew my mind. From the time we walked into the hotel we were greeted with a warm welcome and our check in was quick and effortless. The staff were extremely polite,approachable and accommodating. The concierge was a tremendous help to us as well since he organized tickets, arranged for taxis, helped with walking directions and even recommended restaurants. All in all, we were always made to feel welcome. Having stayed at some of the finest hotels around the world in the past, I can assure you that it is very difficult to find a hotel that lives up to all of the hype. A hotel that is ideally located might have horrible service whereas a hotel that has great service might have tiny rooms. The Villa and Hotel Majestic, however, is one of those rare few that offer great service, great location and great rooms. I don't know when my next trip to Paris will be but when I do go back, I know that I will definitely be checking in to the Villa and Hotel Majestic again.

Reviews.Title: “A stunning jewel and oasis in the 16th, almost perdection"”
Reviews.Author: mrsmikael
Reviews.Content: great "equipe" here, everyone, from the front desk staff to the bellboys, stunningly helpful and charming. A special "chapeau" to Joel in the bar and room service department, very elegant manners and truly understands great customer service, going well out of his way to find me a little chocolate cookie, etc. to make me happy..the hotel itself is gorgeous, very quiet, and with a wonderful design.My "room" felt like a proper Haussmanian apartment, all diagonal wood parquet floors, very high ceilings, and a terrific chandelier. Beautiful fittings, all top notch, wonderful spa , beautiful pool, a genuinely swimmable good sized indoor pool, and whatever they are using it to keep it clean is very well appreciated as the water felt smooth as silk and no chlorine odor. They also have infrared saunas, my favorite, and nice steam room. No complaints at all, except please add a few more items to room service, but then, you're in Paris, and who needs to eat in with the city at your feet.? "chapeau" to the management of this gorgeous place for hiring top notch professionals who have beautiful manners, so important , most important in a fine hotel experience. Oh , also, the bar and entry are stunning, really terrific elegant design with a bit of whimsy. oh and GREAT beds, what are these mattresses? Thanks Villa Majestic, will definitely be back..

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: shawno360
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed 4 nights in a suite; we were in Paris for sightseeing. I wanted a higher end hotel with a pool for the kids to enjoy, and Hotel Majestic was perfect in that regard. GREAT indoor pool, gym, and full service spa (nice to a massage after a day of touring!). Our room was large and clean. Beds very comfortable. AC was average...we could not get the room below 23 degrees even if we had it set on 12. There is MAJOR re-construction directly across the street from the hotel. Its our of the Hotel's control, but a little loud and dusty outside right now. The location is very nice to major sites, a 3 minute walk to Arc de Triumphe and 10 minutes to Effiel Tower. The service was absolutely terrific. The reception staff was helpful, focused, and fast moving. Their recommendations were spot on, they got us into room early, etc. I was very close to giving Hotel Majestic 5 stars, but a few small things held me back. No free internet in rooms (it is free in lobby), inconsistent billing for room service and drinks in hotel bar, and average AC leave this hotel just short of perfect.

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller43
Reviews.Content: This hotel has topped the list of best hotels I have ever stayed in. After travelling through Scandinavia for 2 weeks, with tiny rooms, this was a breath of fresh air and blew life into us all. The rooms are big, beautifully decorated and very very comfortable. There is a very functional kitchen also as part of the room. The staff are fantastic, nothing is a bother for them. There is a beautiful pool. And the location is fantastic, close to lots of landmarks, high-end shops and even supermarkets. This hotel is not cheap but worth every dollar. I can not believe such a gem even exists in Paris. I can not wait to go back to Paris just to stay at this beautiful place again. My only criticism is lack of free internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Limited in character”
Reviews.Author: NIKKI13172
Reviews.Content: Positives were the superb hotel swimming pool & spa area - wonderful. The hotel was very clean and did have nice modern rooms. The concierge was helpful. Negatives were the breakfast and lack of atmosphere within the hotel. I appreciate that we went in December and this probably contributed to the lack of guests, but on one occasion we had to wait 20 minutes to be served in the bar for a drink.We also had a problem with our bill upon check out, charged for breakfast on one day when it was included in the tariff, this took a few e mails to rectify.

Reviews.Title: “Brief but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mrswrighty
Reviews.Content: After a heavy snow fall, all flights out of Paris airports were cancelled. After many long hours I eventually made it to the Majestic hotel at 11pm. This was one of the last available rooms in Paris and was hugely expensive but needs must. It must be said that the hotel is beautiful and situated not far from the Champs Elysee. However, I was really disappointed with my very brief stay when I found the service to be quite unhelpful. I explained that I was leaving before 6am the following morning to head back to the airport and as this was much earlier than breakfast, I asked if it was possible for the hotel to put something together, even a croissant for me to take. The answer was a flat no. When my company were paying approximately 500 euros for 1 night stay, I found this to be most unaccommodating. The hotel may look good but it hardly seems to go the extra mile that the cost would lead me to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience...!”
Reviews.Author: Tikalyani
Reviews.Content: When i came in the Villa, I was moving from a cold street near the Champs Elysées, to a welcoming, modern and warm place... We could appreciate a wide range of the Villa's facilities : indoor swimming-pool, hammam, sauna, fitness center, nice lounge. We stayed in a deluxe room, around 20 sq with a king size bed, mini bar.... It was very comfortable, there was no noise at all, and we slept very well. And last but not least , the staff is really professional. I really enjoyed my stay

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: rypiphi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on our honeymoon and our flight arrived at 7 am, not knowing if we would be able to check into our hotel we were hesitant about what to do, when we arrived at the hotel, Benoit checked us into our room and we were able to relax after a long flight- it was unexpected and so appreciated. The hotel itself is beautifully decorated, the service excellent, the rooms large and nicely appointed, and the beds were so comfortable! The location of the hotel is ideal for those looking for a quiet street near to the tourist areas. We can't say enough about the wonderful staff and this hotel- thanks for everything!

Reviews.Title: “Majestic is the whole package”
Reviews.Author: BossFan62
Reviews.Content: This is a recently renovated hotel, not to be confused with the budget Majestic reviewed elsewhere on Tripadvisor. I had not stayed here before, but whatever they did, they did right. The location is great, just three blocks from the Champs Elysee. Our two bedroom suite was room, elegantly appointed with a modern feel but lots of comfort. The hotel's pool is wonderful for kids, and we were the only ones using it the entire time we were there. Good fitness center as well. Room service menu is typical French - way too complicated for kids - but they were flexible in bringing modified dishes that worked for our kids. And the staff, from welcome to departure, were wonderful. If you called, somebody was there within two minutes - incredible - and they were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for discovering paris”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller4957
Reviews.Content: Bonjour I say --we booked the hotel through Eurostar Holidays before we left New Zealand for a family trip home to the UK. We wanted a special place to stay for our 3 day trip to Paris and the Hotel Majestic is more than a special place Great room more like a small apartment with beautiful big tiled bathrooms and all fitted out out with period furniture. Great location close to the sites and metro. Although pricey its well worth it and the full continental breakfast was included in the Eurostar package. Small lift but who cares take the lift and keep fit -I can recommend this one. Visit there web site its well worth a look

Reviews.Title: “fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: LA.CO.ANTRIM
Reviews.Content: I noticed there were only two reviews about this hotel and one of them must be a mistake as the hotel is not in the Latin quarter and the rooms are huge.When we arrived we thought we'd been given a suite, the bathroom was enormous as was the room itself. The furniture was beautiful French style and the bed was very comfortable. We faced onto a side street and it was very quiet. As the previous trip advisor said breakfast is served in the room and ordered the day before. The breakfast was excellent fresh croissants, cereal, fruit etc. The area was great, between the Champs-Elysee and the Eiffel Tower and it was wihin walking distance to the Bateaux boats which we used for most of our site seeing. The only downside We felt was that the hotel didn't have a bar or Lounge to sit in. But that said there were plenty of resturants nearby and the standard and size of rooms more than compensated for that.
